headline.main: Peddling Caffeine to the Pepsi Generation

docs.abstract: Patricia Lieberman letter scores marketing of caffeinated soft drinks to children; photo (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Your Aug. 22 Business Day article reports a startling new trend of aggressively marketing caffeinated soft drinks to children. But the article ignored one of the worst aspects of adding caffeine to soda. Introducing a mildly addictive drug to soft drinks encourages children to drink sugar water instead of more nutritious beverages like fruit juice and low-fat milk.
